titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Mann Page Papers, 1765-1869
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Colonial Williamsburg Foundation's
John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library MS 31.8
titlepage.publisher: John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

archdesc.runner: John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation
did.unittitle:
Mann Page Papers,
1765-1869.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mann Page Papers, Manuscript MS 31.8, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Mann Page, Jr. (1766-1813), of Shelly, Gloucester County, Va., was the oldest son of John and Frances Burwell Page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers of Mann Page, Jr. Primarily his business accounts and receipts, and legal papers and receipts relating to his position as clerk of the Gloucester County Court. Included are a few letters pertaining to financial matters at Rosewell, and a letter, August 11, 1787, from John Mason, a student at the College of William and Mary, to Page, stating that there were only five students in the college at the time. A few later accounts were probably kept by Page's descendants.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Chronologically arranged. Undated materials including the five volumes are placed at the end.

controlaccess.head: Corporate Names:
controlaccess.corpname: College of William and Mary--Students-- History--18th century.
